title: Changing Ownership
content:
chown and chgrp

Ownership changes often require elevated privileges (e.g., sudo).

# Examples (may require sudo)
# sudo chown alice file.txt
# sudo chown alice:staff file.txt
# sudo chgrp staff file.txt

When to use

  • Fix ownership after copying files as root
  • Prepare directories for services/users
  • Manage shared folders via groups
